intro: Camptacra robusta, commonly known as the robust camptacra, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its robust, upright growth habit. The plant features large, palmately lobed leaves and produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in warm climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally grown in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
